meanings.definition: A person who haggles or negotiates over prices.
meanings.sent1: The chafferer at the market always tries to get the best deal.
meanings.sent2: The chafferer spent hours negotiating the price of the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The chafferer's skills were put to the test when trying to buy a new car.
meanings.sent4: She was a master chafferer, able to talk down any price with ease.
meanings.sent5: The chafferer's ability to negotiate saved him a lot of money over the years.

meanings.definition: To bargain or haggle over prices.
meanings.sent1: Customers often chafferer with street vendors to get a lower price.
meanings.sent2: She decided to chafferer with the salesperson to get a discount on the dress.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would chafferer playfully over who got the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The two parties continued to chafferer back and forth, trying to reach a deal.
meanings.sent5: He knew he had to chafferer if he wanted to afford the painting he loved.
